programme.desc: An ex-soldier visits Aidensfield on holiday and his daughter strikes up a relationship with a local farm hand. Greengrass finds himself the owner of stolen cigarettes and Jo receives tragic news. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Nick Berry

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Julia McKenzie returns as the sleuthing spinster in the first of three murder mysteries. While staying at a hotel in the Caribbean, Miss Marple investigates the death of a fellow guest, refusing to believe he died of a heart attack. With the help of a business tycoon she sets about finding the real cause of the man's demise, and is soon drawn into a web of deceit and dark magic. Adapted by Charlie Higson and co-starring Antony Sher, Robert Webb, Montserrat Lombard, Daniel Rigby, Hermione Norris, MyAnna Buring, Warren Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: An otherwise quiet nightshift is disrupted when a group of young American airmen are arrested for trespassing at the local quarry and brought to the station. When one of the airmen collapses and dies, Geordie and Will must try and work out how he could have been murdered in plain sight, in police custody. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green

programme.desc: The second leg of the UK tour sees Ali and Bobby attempt to catch a monster shark over 400lbs from just off the north Devon coast. Sci-fi thriller, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ronny Cox and Miguel Ferrer

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. In the first episode, he shares a roast chicken recipe that saves both time and money by filling chicken thighs with a super-simple stuffing to make the meat stretch further. Plus, a pancake batter-based dish with layers of spinach, ham and cheese and a pizza that doesn't even need you to turn on the oven

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice travels from London to Washington, DC meeting people who are entering relationships with multiple partners in a bid for more sex and a deeper connection, including a 20-person polycule - a group of open-minded lovers who have created an ever-evolving support system through their intertwined sex lives. Back in the British suburbs, she meet a young married couple whose dalliances with other couples has helped strengthen their relationship

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Vogue Williams meets glamour model Maddison, who believes bigger breasts will help her stand out, and film graduate Tom, whose current penis size is knocking his confidence. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them and hear from our feedback panel?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Arvada, Colorado, where a husband and wife have allowed their restaurant to fall into disrepair. Randy's hoarding is out of control, while Alexa, who runs the kitchen, has a lot to learn. To make matters worse, the Old Neighborhood is one of the filthiest eateries the fiery chef has ever seen, and only one of the biggest transformations of the series can save the business

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Audrey and Jeff Lovelock, who dream of living in one of west London's most exclusive areas. However, the only way they can afford it is to go underground. Their plan is to transform a listed Edwardian artist's studio - along with 5,000 square feet of derelict basement - into a bespoke subterranean home, complete with supersize kitchen, mezzanine sitting room, four en-suite bedrooms, a gym, cinema, steam room and wine cellar. As if the task was not tricky enough, they are doing it without proper architects' drawings and Audrey is project managing - and the difficulties begin almost from the start

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: In Devon, Sandi is joined by comedian Sarah Millican to explore a Scandi-inspired architectural retreat ingeniously built into a hillside and tucked away in a small wood. In Lee Bay on the north coast, the pair stay in a 16th-century mill house dramatically positioned on the water's edge that is full of both history and surprises. Their final stop is Crowness Cleave where they enjoy a private spa retreat before experiencing the ultimate form of relaxation - a gong bath

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.desc: The presenter travels to the Azores islands, a remote archipelago in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean, to meet Magnus, Lucy and one-year-old Frey. The family live in an off-grid cottage on a steep sloped mountain which Magnus's nomadic father bought in the 1980s, and they have spent the past 15 years taking on the gargantuan task of restoring the property and land

programme.title: The Disappearance of Grace Millane
programme.desc: The inside story of the team of officers tasked with catching the killer of British backpacker Grace Millane, and how her attacker Jesse Kempson was brought to justice. Officers involved in the case give first-hand accounts of their efforts to trace Kempson and through the interview footage recount how they gradually unpicked his story and discovered the horrific truth

programme.desc: On a New Forest farm, twin lambs of the rare Valais Blacknose breed are born, but the second lamb is rejected by his mother and his life seems to be taking a different path to that of his sister. Meanwhile, African elephant calf Nusu is growing up fast, but cannot quite master all of his various appendages, and when he tries to run on muddy ground, he ends up in a heap. Elsewhere, Oberon the Lusitano foal learns the art of dressage, hoping to follow in the hoofsteps of his father and become an Olympic champion

programme.title: Wonderful World of Baby Animals
programme.desc: Baby three-banded armadillo Ellie goes on her first adventure outside the nest. A Malayan tapir called Megat begins to investigate his world with the help of his short trunk and ostrich chick Oswald performs a whirling dance routine every morning

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Dan Jones examines Britain's most iconic canals, beginning with the 152-mile Grand Union Canal, which runs up the spine of the country. Constructed at the height of the Industrial Revolution, the task challenged even the greatest engineering minds of the time, including pioneers such as James Brindley, the man behind Britain's first commercial canal, and William Jessop, the person with whom responsibility lay for the building of the main link from Birmingham to London. Travelling along its route, Dan experiences first-hand the innovations behind its construction, including the Blisworth tunnel

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Ortis, Georgie and a guest family road-test some brilliant gadgets in the real world, including cameras to help them take great photos and make memorable videos, a compact TV surround sound system, and a gaming monitor which frees up the TV for the rest of the family, all without spending big. programme.title: 5 News Update

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: The warm summer days continue in Dalby and Cropton Forests, and cameras capture the forest's youngsters as they investigate their new surroundings, from fawns nervously exploring, to badger cubs appearing out of their setts for the first time and learning how to play-fight with their siblings. Meanwhile at the beaver pond, cameras follow herons as they lurk by the water and stalk their prey

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Black Death
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dan Snow and archaeologist Raksha Dave investigate how the Black Death devastated Britain 700 years ago, killing around three million people across the country. In the first edition, Dan heads to Melcombe Regis in Dorset as he traces the spread of the plague and finds out how the disease reached Britain's shores in 1348. At The Old Operating Theatre in London, Raksha witnesses the horrific symptoms of this deadly disease and the terrifying outcome for those who fell victim to it, and also investigates the recent discovery of mass graves beneath a tranquil London square

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: It's another busy day for the casualty team with patient numbers unusually high. Sister Rachel is running the shift, and she's under pressure with a shortage of cubicles - to make matters worse, IT systems start to fail across the hospital, causing chaos for patient flow. Urgent treatment is needed for 75-year-old Janet, who's been viciously attacked by a dog and has a large flap of skin hanging from her elbow

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PC Andy Doran chases thieves on the run from a shop robbery in Ellesmere Port, where they have reportedly stolen thousands of pounds worth of goods. When the suspect vehicle is finally spotted 70 miles from the crime scene on the M6, Andy and two other patrols must be quick to stop the criminals before they get away

programme.title: Police Raids: Caught by Surprise
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following enforcement agencies carrying out raids across Britain as they take action against fraudsters, counterfeiters and criminals. Trading Standards officers raid more than 20 shipping containers tucked away on an industrial estate in London, uncovering millions of pounds' worth of fake goods, including hi-tech items and knock-off designer accessories

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc: After a raid on a cannabis factory, nine people are arrested and it is up to the team at Norwich CID to get to the bottom of which role each suspect played. In the interview room, different stories emerge and the detectives face a daunting challenge to determine who is telling the truth and who is spinning lies

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc: The team in Norwich gathers evidence about a single-punch attack that has left a man with a serious brain injury, but no witnesses are willing to come forward to identify the culprit. In another incident, a pensioner is allegedly attacked and robbed just outside a betting shop, but, once again no-one present can identify the person responsible

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Writer and historian Dan Jones navigates Britain's longest canal to be built by just one company, the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Built to link the economically booming counties of Yorkshire and Lancashire, this 19th-century superhighway was experimental for the time, and made Liverpool the busiest port in the world. In Burnley, the cotton capital of the 19th century, Dan visits the world's only steam-powered cotton mill, where enough cloth was woven each year to reach to the moon and back two-and-a-half times

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George help Daddy Pig when he loses his glasses, but they can't find them either - until Mummy makes a suggestion

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Blaze-tackling antics with the friendly firefighter from Pontypandy

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Farmer Al's farm is flooded, so the Paw Patrol needs to rescue him

programme.title: The War Lover (1962)
programme.desc: Bomber commander Buzz Rickson is respected by his crew for his daredevil abilities in the air, but his personal life is a disaster. His co-pilot initially idolises the fearless airman, but over time becomes increasingly aware of his hero's flaws - especially when Rickson starts pursuing his comrade's girlfriend. Second World War drama, with Steve McQueen, Robert Wagner and Shirley Anne Field

programme.title: Crack in the World (1965)
programme.desc: A dying scientist and his colleagues conduct experiments to harness the Earth's inner energy that seem set to end in disaster. Sci-fi thriller, with Dana Andrews, Janette Scott, Kieron Moore and Alexander Knox

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek (1952)
programme.desc: A gambler goes after the gang of claim jumpers who killed his father, and joins forces with an injured marshal who also wants the criminals brought to justice. However, their partnership is tested when a devious femme fatale enters their lives. Don Siegel's Western, starring Audie Murphy, Stephen McNally and Faith Domergue

programme.title: Strategic Air Command (1955)
programme.desc: A pilot relishes the opportunity to return to the baseball pitch once the Second World War is over. However, his sporting career is put on hold when he's drafted back into the US Air Force and given the opportunity to fly a revolutionary new jet. Drama, starring James Stewart, Frank Lovejoy, Barry Sullivan, Alex Nicol and June Allyson

programme.title: Suffragette (2015)
programme.desc: A woman joins a campaign to gain the right to vote in 1912. She and her allies find their peaceful protests accomplishing little in the face of an unwavering state, so resort to increasingly violent measures, risking everything they have in the pursuit of political justice. Period drama, starring Carey Mulligan, Helena Bonham Carter, Anne-Marie Duff and Meryl Streep

programme.title: The Godfather (1972)
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppola's gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

programme.title: Parasite (2019)
programme.desc: A family living in poverty and getting by through an assortment of scams hatch a plan to infiltrate a wealthy household. They trick their way into assorted domestic staff jobs - ruthlessly ousting the established servants and devising ways of making their naive but self-centred employers' luxurious home their own. Oscar-winning South Korean satirical thriller, starring Kang-ho Song and Sun-kyun Lee. In Korean and English

programme.title: Last Train from Gun Hill (1959)
programme.desc: A marshal discovers the man responsible for raping and killing his wife is actually the son of an old friend, setting the scene for a showdown. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Anthony Quinn, Brian Hutton and Carolyn Jones

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat (1957)
programme.desc: A lieutenant deserts after his commanding officer launches an unprovoked attack on a Comanche village during the Civil War. Realising that there are no soldiers in his home town to protect it from reprisals, he returns to train the local women to defend themselves. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Kathryn Grant, Hope Emerson and Jeff Donnell

programme.title: Man of the West (1958)
programme.desc: Reformed outlaw Link is left stranded in the wilderness with a saloon singer and a conman for company when the train they are travelling on is robbed. By chance they stumble upon Link's old gang holed up in a shack, but his former partners in crime threaten violence against them unless Link agrees to take part in a bank robbery. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Lee J Cobb, Julie London and Arthur O'Connell

programme.title: Billion Dollar Brain (1967)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Harry Palmer comes out of retirement to take a mysterious canister to Finland, and ends up embroiled in an American megalomaniac's bid to take over the world. Espionage thriller, directed by Ken Russell and starring Michael Caine, Oscar Homolka and Karl Malden

programme.title: The Madness of King George (1994)
programme.desc: British monarch George III's behaviour becomes increasingly erratic, prompting fears that he is going insane. While physicians try to uncover the cause of his condition, the king's enemies in Parliament and the frustrated Prince of Wales conspire to have him declared insane and removed from the throne. Period drama based on Alan Bennett's play, starring Nigel Hawthorne, Helen Mirren and Rupert Everett

programme.title: The Godfather Part II (1974)
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michael's story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito, as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale, Michael V Gazzo and Lee Strasberg

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July (1989)
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's fact-based drama chronicles the life of Ron Kovic, an eager-to-impress, patriotic Marine Corps recruit, who endures terrifying experiences during the Vietnam conflict that leave him paralysed from the chest down. On his return home, he undergoes a harrowing journey of physical and mental recovery that leads him to question the whole purpose of the war. Starring Tom Cruise, Willem Dafoe, Kyra Sedgwick and Josh Evans

programme.title: A Town Like Alice (1956)
programme.desc: Second World War PoW Jean Paget is sent on a gruelling forced march between Japanese labour camps, but finds comfort in her friendship with Australian captive Joe Harman. During the journey Joe is caught stealing, tied to a cross and left to die. After the conflict is over, Jean is startled to receive a letter postmarked in Joe's home town of Alice Springs. Jack Lee's drama, based on the novel by Nevil Shute, starring Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch, Takagi and Jean Anderson

programme.title: The Furies (1950)
programme.desc: The daughter of a ruthlessly ambitious cattle baron is divided between her love for one of his enemies and the prospect of taking over the family ranch when he dies. But when the cruel rancher has one of her friends hanged, she begins plotting his downfall. Western from director Anthony Mann, starring Barbara Stanwyck and Walter Huston

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex (1958)
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh

programme.title: Proxima (2019)
programme.desc: A French engineer sets out on a year-long space mission as her daughter grapples with her impending absence. Drama, starring Eva Green, Zélie Boulant-Lemesle and Matt Dillon

programme.title: Amulet (2020)
programme.desc: A homeless ex-soldier is offered a place to stay at a decaying house inhabited by a young woman and her dying mother. The smitten former trooper soon suspects something sinister is going on. Writer/director Romola Garai's horror, starring Carla Juri, Alec Secareanu, and Imelda Staunton

programme.title: Things to Come (2016)
programme.desc: A high-school philosophy teacher is forced to re-examine her life when her husband leaves her for another woman. Drama, starring Isabelle Huppert, Andre Marcon and Roman Kolinka. In French, German and English

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The McQueens come up with creative ways to make money. Later, Rayne is forced to make a confession, and Sienna and Grace clash

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes accidently reveals the truth to the wrong person, and Diane's concern for Tony grows as he swaps sleep for productivity

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. After identifying the most pressing issues at each location, he puts the owners and staff to work as he attempts to save their establishments from disaster. His first stop is Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, where the Roosevelt Inn is more than $1million in debt - and to make matters worse, the owner's wife has had enough

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Despite Beverly's wishes, Jackie's parents allow Adam to watch horror movie A Nightmare on Elm Street, and a family disagreement ensues. Meanwhile, Erica starts hanging out at her old high school and soon realises she's not as popular as she once was

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray is angered when he finds out that Adam has no interest in auditioning for a school stage production. Meanwhile, Beverly interferes with Erica's latest career plan

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard questions his engineering abilities when he and Sheldon can't get a toy drone to fly. A cancelled flight almost stops Leonard from giving the commencement address at his former high school, while Raj pits his parents against each other when his father cuts him off financially

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: There is a clash of personalities when Sheldon and Leonard's mothers finally meet, while Howard finally decides to do his fair share of the housework - but not without a little help from his friends. Guest starring Christine Baranski and Laurie Metcalf

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire try to squeeze in some time alone, while Mitch and Cam make a big decision. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Nerves jangle as Luke and Manny face their first day at high school. Cam takes on a substitute gig, leaving Mitch to look after Lily. American comedy, starring Eric Stonestreet and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is assigned to a minor graffiti case by Captain Holt as punishment for turning up late for work, but the investigation becomes a major headache when the vandal's identity is revealed. Meanwhile, Gina's psychic friend Carlene visits the precinct to help with a case, and upsets Charles with a prediction about his romantic life. American comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: For the first time in his career, Jake has a growing number of cases he just can't seem to solve, and the other detectives worry his run of bad luck will rub off on them. Holt asks Amy to take charge of a community outreach programme for at-risk youths, and Boyle helps Jeffords with a tough personal assignment. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj organise a stag party for Howard, but stories about his sexual history are unwittingly revealed, and he has to persuade bride-to-be Bernadette not to call off the wedding. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny struggles with Leonard's confession that he kissed another woman when he was away on his North Sea research expedition. After driving all the way to Las Vegas, she must now decide whether she wants to go through with the wedding. Back home, Sheldon doesn't know how to act after Amy tells him she wants them to take a relationship break

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Conflict arises when Leonard's newly divorced parents and Sheldon's devoutly religious mother are all in town at the same time. And when Howard and Raj are contacted about the guidance system they've developed, they assume that the government is out to get them. Laurie Metcalf, Christine Baranski and Judd Hirsch guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mitch and Cam prepare to walk down the aisle, but are faced with a host of hitches before they tie the knot. Pepper is forced to bring the ceremony forward by four hours because of a spreading wildfire, while one of the grooms' tuxedos has been left at the dry cleaners

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Mitch and Cam's big day beset by one disaster after another, Pepper is forced to find a new venue - only for the couple to be forced out once again. Their only option is to hold the ceremony at home - but then Sal, who supposed to be marrying them, is forced to leave. Will they ever get to say 'I do'? Elizabeth Banks guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: As the wedding of Gina's mother and Boyle's father arrives, each member of the squad is given a task to complete for the big day. However, Peralta and Santiago get sidetracked chasing a criminal, and Jeffords struggles to officiate at the ceremony. Comedy, guest starring Sandra Bernhard and Nick Cannon

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad springs into action when Jake and Amy's wedding is jeopardised by a major threat. Holt is reluctant to open the email saying whether he has been appointed Commissioner

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends struggle through an awkward morning after Sheldon's mother and Leonard's father share an evening together. Penny's family arrives in town to attend Penny and Leonard's second wedding ceremony. Keith Carradine, Laurie Metcalf, Christine Baranski and Judd Hirsch guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang become concerned when Sheldon's former admirer Dr Ramona Nowitzki resurfaces while Amy is away working at Princeton University. Jim Parsons stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Sheldon stresses out about picking a wedding date, Amy tries to convince him that he has a more laid-back side. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart compete to win the heart of Bernadette's new colleague Ruchi. Swati Kapila guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Friends and family gather as Amy and Sheldon prepare to tie the knot - but it seems the happy couple's minds are elsewhere. Jim Parsons and Mayim Bialik star, with guest appearances from Laurie Metcalf, Kathy Bates, Mark Hamill, Jerry O'Connell and Teller (the quiet half of US magic duo Penn and Teller)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna, Ethan and Warren clash over parenting. Later, Romeo accuses Rayne of sleeping with his best friend, but soon realises that he has got the wrong end of the stick

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: A fresh group of singles embarks on the social experiment, with the first two matched couples being Lyndall and Cameron, and Bronte and Harrison

programme.desc: Sixteen famous faces undergo special forces training by coaches Mark Billingham, Jason Fox, Rudy Reyes and Remi Adeleke. Taking part are Danny Amendola, Mel B, Hannah Brown, Tyler Florence, Kate Gosselin, Dwight Howard, Montell Jordan, Gus Kenworthy, Nastia Liukin, Carli Lloyd, Beverley Mitchell, Kenya Moore, Mike Piazza, Drew Pinsky, Anthony Scaramucci and Jamie Lynn Spears

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Part two of the opening edition sees the fall-out from the revelations reverberating through Harrison and Bronte's big day

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: Maya travels to London for her best friend Ainsley's wedding, reconnecting with her old college friends Craig and Duffy and finding herself thrust into their personal crises. Comedy adapted from the 1994 film, starring Nikesh Patel, Nathalie Emmanuel, Rebecca Rittenhouse, Brandon Mychal Smith and John Reynolds

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Manchester 'player' Geo is pulling out all the stops in his attempts to impress 19-year-old Heather - he even brings champagne and flowers. But how will she feel after he tells his favourite joke? Clay-pigeon enthusiast Emma seems a good match for finance broker Jeremy - but soon discovers she has to compete with his work phone - while 82-year-old Harvey isn't letting his age get in the way as he tries to win the heart of lifelong singleton Dinah

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Dom from Hampshire has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Croft Farm Park in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, where owners Jason and Michelle Jones are keen to show off their new luxury lodges

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests arrive at Harbour Vista in Poole, Dorset, where most of them have been expecting something lavish - so they are surprised to be staying in owner Steve Webster's house

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. Heather and Sally from Brockley Hall Hotel want some answers about why one of their rooms didn't scrub up. Plus, Alistair from The Star Inn 1744 queries his guests' cleanliness comments

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two sets of house-hunters who battled the property markets either side of the Thames. In 2018, Emily and Dustin had saved a healthy deposit, but in the north London market, they were finding it hard to secure their first home. In 2009, it was all about location for Sarah and Ian. Fixated on their beloved Balham, but without the budget for two bedrooms, Phil Spencer had to employ some creative thinking in order to fulfil their wish list. Now he returns to find out how they have got on since cameras stopped rolling

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: In the first episode of a new series, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Rowland family in Stoke-on-Trent who are unsure whether to sell their home or renovate their current property instead. Hospital worker Julie is unhappy with their house and longs to live in a spacious character property, but Allen does not think they will find anything better than what they currently have within in their budget. After a decade long debate, can Phil and Kirstie help the pair make the right decision?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Arthur and Dorothy are now seven and eight, and growing up fast. They will soon need separate bedrooms - so Angel comes up with an ingenious plan to create a mezzanine. As the re-slating of the roof continues, Dick and Angel not only launch into knocking down walls and building new ones but preserving old wallpaper, creating memory furnishings from the kids' old clothes, as well as finding time to pick some strawberries in the garden

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud looks at the challenges of self-building in the countryside, where design must embrace and enhance tradition, yet often overcome stringent planning constraints. Drawing on footage from the show, as well as new visits to extraordinary homes, he finds out how pioneers at the forefront of architecture are transforming agricultural and historic buildings, and bringing cutting-edge contemporary design to rural parts

programme.title: World's Greatest Train Journeys from Above
programme.desc: A journey across Manitoba from South to North. The Winnipeg to Churchill train is filmed from above as it winds through snow-covered grasslands, Canada's Boreal Forest and into the frozen barren lands, just below the Arctic Circle. It's a constant struggle to keep on track as engineers battle with snow and ice in temperatures that reach as low as minus 45

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring catalogue of errors that occurred in the run-up to the nuclear disaster, examining newly declassified evidence from the KGB archives about the safety of the plant. The programme examines concerns that had been voiced while the nuclear plant was still under construction, but which were ignored by the Soviet leaders

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Becky, 59, is rushed in after a suspected stroke, and medics are concerned she may have had a bleed on the brain. Georgia, 19, locked herself out of her flat and lost her balance trying to climb through a second-floor window, falling 20ft on to concrete. She's sent for an urgent CT scan with possible spinal injuries. Meanwhile, 88-year-old Edith is kept under observation after collapsing at home

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition kicks off at The Somerset House Hotel in Weymouth, run by couple Adam Borton and Holly Syme, who hope their boutique-style rooms and BBQ breakfast will whet their guests' appetite. Guests Sam and Mandy are blown away by their surroundings, but Belinda and Brenda aren't fans of the noise and find the sofa bed to be a bad bunk. In the morning, the breakfast gets a grilling and Sandeep and Vaishalee's revelations leave the group with high expectations

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the seaside town of Dawlish in Devon, where the owner of the Knitting Hotel, Belinda Harris-Reid, and her colleague Brenda Watson hope that their guests will get excited about all things woolly. Most of the guests embrace the hotel's theme, but the minimal feel to the rooms leaves Adam and Holly berating the lack of the basics

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group heads to Stade Court Hotel in Hythe in Kent, where owners Sandeep and Vaishalee Chawla have a hosting policy of treating their guests like a god. However, some guests have cleanliness concerns, with Holly and Adam having to call in the management

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mandy McCready and her assistant Sam Gould welcome their rivals to the Goodlife Guest House, a family business in Harwich in Essex. As their guests pull into the car park, the location is met with raised eyebrows but the B&Bers are pleasantly surprised when they see their rooms. During an afternoon of crabbing on Harwich pier, Sandeep and Vaishalee reveal that they're still struggling to shake off Belinda's feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores, with Adam Borton and Holly Syme from the Somerset House Hotel keen to put Belinda and Brenda's sleeping issues to bed

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting in Surrey. Kirstie searches for a home for newly-weds Marie and Rob. They love the village lifestyle but need help bagging a bargain in this expensive spot. Meanwhile, Phil offers his assistance to retired couple Kay and Robert, who are struggling with their plans to downsize after selling their home of 25 years

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet a family in Cullercoats in North Tyneside who are divided on whether they should sell their home or renovate their current property instead. Suze Drummond has emotional ties to their four-bed Victorian townhouse, but Mark wants to find a property with a better layout, bigger garden and a driveway for their car. Can Kirstie and Phil help them make the right decision?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel discovers that the chateau has a vast attic space running the length of the building and rising to the ridge of the roof. While Dick is glad to have some more storage space, Angel has bigger plans - transforming it into a space-inspired bar complete with balconies from which they can watch the stars. The project will require skylights, a new staircase and unique use of insulation - but proves worth it when a cloudless night provides the perfect chance to look for shooting stars

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: In the third of four special programmes, Kevin McCloud reveals how self-builders in the suburbs are transforming this most maligned of residential environments. He draws on some of the best examples from the 15-year history of Grand Designs, talks to experts in the latest architectural thinking and reveals the designs that have reinvented the suburbs as a place where home-owners really can have it all

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: With building works banned and builders doubling as speedboat drivers in the summer, Sara's build is under pressure with just five weeks till the Greek tourist season begins

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Betting shop owner Les, 40, is rushed to St George's after losing control of his car on a country road on his way to work. Cambelle, a 21-year-old plumber, has an infected cyst that may require surgery, while 67-year-old retired doctor Patrick is brought to A&E following a horse-riding accident in which he was dragged 130ft and not found for more than two hours

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics and the air ambulance rush to save an elderly man who has life-changing injuries following a fall from a ladder. At the same time in Birmingham, a newly qualified paramedic struggles to treat a man who has had three major epileptic fits and is in a delirious and combative state. In Coventry, paramedics Neil Vann and Laura Perkins help a young girl who has passed out and needs urgent medical attention

programme.title: Home Greek Home

Danni Menzies finds five options for their £120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joe and Emma from Kent have been married for 21 years. After years of holidaying in Spain, they've decided to sell up in the UK and make a permanent move along with their daughter Gracie to Spain's Mar Menor. Armed with a budget of £90,000, Ben Hillman sets out to find the pair the perfect property

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen, where for owners Ronnie and Steph Caird, it's all about keeping it in the family. When the guests arrive, design-conscious father and son Steve and Allard take a trip back in time, and John isn't flushed with praise for his bathroom. At dinner, John reveals his culinary background, piling on the pressure for Ronnie to deliver a good breakfast. Fiona and Shauna's sizeable confession raises eyebrows, while in the morning, Ronnie has a breakfast to forget and the bathroom blues leave Ronnie and Steph seeking answers from their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire, where events manager Shauna Kirk and sales manager Fiona Gallagher prove a force to be reckoned with. Guests Steve and Allard aren't feeling the dated décor, and John proves that one size doesn't fit all. Ronnie and Steph are blown away by the competition, but they think that perfection comes at a price

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group heads to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District, where owners Steve and Allard Newell have proudly built their B&B from the ground up

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay at the Lynbar Hotel in Blackpool, where Ronnie and Steph have parking problems, while confident owner John O'Donnell boasts of serving the best breakfast in town

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house hunting in Essex and East London. programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It

Jamie Lea wants to settle down and enjoy family life in their three-bed terrace, but Curtis wants a bigger house with a better garden in the countryside for their growing family

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau

Part of a traditional device used for making cider is discovered while clearing out the piggery, so the hunt is soon on to locate the rest of it. Inspired by the ancient piece of machinery, the family collects apples to make their very own juice

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architect and shed fanatic Micah Jones, who plans to transform an old agricultural building in Co Down. Micah plans an upside-down, four-bedroom shed using new techniques and materials, but the £200,000 budget runs short and Micah is forced to take on some of the building work himself

programme.title: Falklands War: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Documentary examining the Falklands conflict 40 years on. The head of the SAS in the Falklands, Sir Michael Rose, speaks publicly for the first time about the war, and how the British task force came close to defeat. Plus, ground troops and senior commanders, many for the first time, reveal how an unexpected change in the plan for the land campaign nearly cost Britain the war, and led to unnecessary loss of life at the iconic Battle of Goose Green, and in the sinking of the Sir Galahad

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cora, 62, arrives by air ambulance following a high-speed road accident, which left her trapped in the car for more than an hour. Her husband Rae, 65, who was driving, is brought in soon after, and staff are concerned he may have sustained serious head, neck and internal injuries. Scott, 23, has badly cut his knee after a night out, and while he's being treated, he reflects on his schizophrenia diagnosis as a teenager. Retired carpenter Richard, 68, has fallen and hit his head on the pavement, but medics also want to look into his unusually low blood pressure

Alex Horne helps coax the contestants to reveal how comic, creative and seriously competitive they are

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads

programme.desc: Greg Davies sets challenges for Roisin Conaty, Tim Key, Romesh Ranganathan, Frank Skinner and Josh Widdicombe. They have to fill an egg cup with tears, remember an Aussie rules football team and play Taskmaster squash

programme.title: Mock the Week

programme.title: QI XL

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Cliff Walker and Angela Adkin from Nottingham fell in love with St Lucia when they were on a Caribbean cruise, and now, after discovering their pensions aren't performing as well as they'd like, they've decided to invest in a property there. Can Jasmine Harman find a place that will be a sound investment and also give them and their family an idyllic holiday home for years to come, all for their £120,000 budget?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King is in Spain's Orihuela Costa to help Donna and Graeme find their perfect holiday home. They're after a light and airy two or three-bedroom apartment. Leah seeks out five impressive properties for the couple's budget of £75,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In Spain, yoga teacher Tessa risks everything as she tries her hand at hosting weddings from her brand new luxury location. In Portugal, restaurant owners Romain and Ana, who struggled with the impact of Covid, are finally starting to reap the rewards of their hard work

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around north London, where first host, 45-year-old estate agent Suzie, is hoping to wow her guests with an evening dedicated to her mixed heritage

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael hosts the second night in north London, hoping his Italian-inspired menu featuring homemade pasta and chocolate fondant will win over his guests, but his entertainment is the star of the show

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week is Shivz who is hoping her tried and tested menu full of favourites will impress her guests. With talk at the table turning to pelicans, politics, professions and punchlines, will Shivz's cooking and poolside party be enough to win them over?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the penultimate night in and around north London, insurance underwriter Fraser treats his guests to an Asian-inspired menu. There's a clash over cruises, stand-up surprises and a sunset singalong, but will Fraser's cooking be enough for him to grab the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in and around north London, public relations executive Melissa presents her menu of Greek Cypriot classics. After a week of shocking singing, bad piano playing and even worse impressions, it's up to Melissa to show that she has what it takes to win the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent couple Alison and Lee are making a permanent move to the stunning countryside of Albox in Almería. They need a garden that's secure enough for their four dogs to roam safely, and the property must be big enough to host their six grown-up children and three grandchildren. Ben Hillman lines up some impressive properties for their budget of £150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: With their children having left home, Maureen and Brian Kellengher want to downsize and enjoy their retirement. However, while they love the idea of staying close to family and friends along the Suffolk-Essex border, they're excited about starting a whole new life in Lanzarote. Jonnie Irwin shows them three beautiful properties for their budget of £320,000 to tempt them to stay in the UK and Jasmine Harman goes all out with three properties for £225,000 in Lanzarote

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales
programme.desc: The male lambs need to be separated from the females. Molly and Nicola help Janice to bring some freshly laid eggs to the barn, where they'll need to be incubated before hatching into the next generation of rare-breed chickens. The final stages of the hay harvest begin, and Matt surprises his dad Mike with a trip to the restoration garage to see what he's been up to with his 1946 Dodge

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller have a tough choice deciding who will go through to the following week's grand finale

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice travels from London to Washington, DC meeting people who are entering relationships with multiple partners in a bid for more sex and a deeper connection, including a 20-person polycule - a group of open-minded lovers who have created an ever-evolving support system through their intertwined sex lives. Back in the British suburbs, she meet a young married couple whose dalliances with other couples has helped strengthen their relationship

programme.title: First Dates Hotel
programme.desc: The final group of singletons check in searching for their perfect partners. They include an Oxford maths undergraduate looking for a good listener - and preferably someone tall - and a hair salon owner who wants someone with whom he can start a family. Also arriving is Elissa, a master of ceremonies for dinners, birthdays and, indeed, weddings. Will her own big day be just around the corner after meeting am-dram enthusiast Rob?

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: The hunt for outstanding amateur pianists continues in Glasgow Central Station with impromptu performances from a local jazz legend, an 86 year-old father of 11, a YouTube star and a boogie woogie biker who believes music is in her DNA. Watching them all in secret are Lang Lang and Mika, who are looking for a performer to play at The Royal Festival Hall

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in and around Liverpool, where the first to host is 41-year-old taxi business owner Rob, who plans a Scouse themed evening. The guests he is hoping to impress are 23-year-old fitness fanatic Toria, 44-year-old property developer Christine, 40-year-old South African business woman Sam, and 20-year-old student Inzy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tina Watkins has long struggled to get on the housing ladder in the UK. Now, she has decided to make the most of the incredibly good value property in Spain's Granada province and buy her first-ever home. With her best friend Jamie along to help, Jasmine Harman shows Tina just how far her £19,000 budget will stretch

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Rick and Inge cannot wait to fulfill their dream of buying a holiday home in Tala in western Cyprus, near the beautiful beaches of Coral Bay. The cat-crazy couple ask Jean Johansson to help them find a detached villa for their budget of £260,000, with plenty of space for a feline family and a 'man cave' for Rick's DIY

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with a father and daughter horse riding duo in Italy, who need to think on their feet if they are to survive another hot Italian summer. Marc and Natalia's paddleboarding business in Spain branches out into new territory, and on the Costa Blanca, Dan, Rik and Rex have their dreams of owning a gin distillery dashed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ptol Slattery hosts the first dinner party in Winchester, Hampshire, but his menu of seared scallops, lamb steak with baby new potatoes followed by chocolate mousse leaves his guests - waitress Patrician Pearson, DJ Francis Leigh, care-home worker Georgia Groves and estate agent William Tilsley - underwhelmed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Francis Leigh hosts the next dinner party in Winchester, hoping to dazzle his guests with his sunburnt chicken curry, a Thai meal with a twist and a dessert simply called 'sticky.' The entertainment for the night proves to be weird and wonderful as he dons a tutu and fur coat to serve the main course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Waitress Patricia Pearson hosts the next party in Winchester, but the decision to write her menu in Spanish causes confusion for one guest who mistakes lamb for llama. The Peruvian-themed feast is followed by a rendition of the country's national anthem and a traditional dance involving a candle and a donkey's jaw

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth night of the competition in Winchester, Georgia Groves plans a black-tie evening complete with a red carpet, posh frocks and a spray-tan booth. It appears to be going well until Patricia Pearson reveals what she thinks of Ptol Slattery and his wine antics

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent William Tilsley throws one last dinner party as a week of competitions in Winchester, Hampshire, draws to a close. The host plans to offer his guests a vegetarian menu, with a blind food-tasting game providing the evening's entertainment. As the night draws to a close, one of the competitors rises above the rest to become the winner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman heads to the Charente region of France to help a couple find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. For their budget of £250,000, Sarah and Greg would like a traditional French cottage or converted barn with four bedrooms in a rural location

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Tim and Lili Maher have sold their house in north London, and with retirement on the horizon, they want to embrace a completely new way of life. They plan to spend most of the year on the northern Costa Blanca but also want to return to the UK to enjoy the English summers. So, the pressure's on to find two new homes. Ben Hillman shows Tim and Lili three properties in Great Yarmouth for their UK budget of £120,000, while Jasmine Harman goes all out on Spanish charm in northern Costa Blanca with their away budget of £240,000

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. In the first episode, he shares a roast chicken recipe that saves both time and money by filling chicken thighs with a super-simple stuffing to make the meat stretch further. Plus, a pancake batter-based dish with layers of spinach, ham and cheese and a pizza that doesn't even need you to turn on the oven

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz as Richard Ayoade and Sara Pascoe take on Jon Richardson and Chris McCausland. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate, aided by Morgana Robinson in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time

programme.title: Bad Teacher (2011)
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc: Katie creates her own makeup room and brings new life to the shabby stables. After spotting a paparazzi photographer, she takes a moment to reflect on how these moments impact her mental health

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice travels from London to Washington, DC meeting people who are entering relationships with multiple partners in a bid for more sex and a deeper connection, including a 20-person polycule - a group of open-minded lovers who have created an ever-evolving support system through their intertwined sex lives. Back in the British suburbs, she meet a young married couple whose dalliances with other couples has helped strengthen their relationship

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Oil and gas co-ordinator Danielle Greenwood is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in the Merseyside area, as she welcomes divorcee Jade Chantelle Short, Michael Buble impersonator Jamie Somers, pastoral care manager Steven Booth, and nursery school teacher Anna Senior into her home. Danielle takes no risks with a down-to-earth menu, which she hopes will help bag her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pastoral care manager Steven Booth hosts the second Merseyside dinner party, and names each course after a Tina Turner song, hoping to win the £1,000 prize. The food is well received, but tensions rise when one guest makes a tactless comment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous PR representative Jade Chantelle hosts the third night in Merseyside, where she hopes a casino-themed evening with lashings of champagne and a high-class menu will help her to win the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Anna Senior hosts the fourth night in Merseyside with a fairy tale-themed evening. Her menu consists of a Mad Hatter's soup and sandwich, a special pork dish cooked three ways and baked cheesecake for dessert, but she must try to control the tension between Jamie and Jade to have a successful party

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael Bublé impersonator Jamie Somers hosts the final Merseyside dinner party, but may have to put aside his differences with guest Jade if he is to be crowned the winner of the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jon and Lynne Scopes from Stockport have thought about buying a property abroad for years and have viewed more than 40 apartments without success, but have at least decided their ideal area is Mijas on Spain's Costa del Sol. Jasmine Harman has the daunting task of finding them the perfect property for their £100,000 budget, but will anything meet their exacting standards?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lou and Tony dream of buying their own Spanish holiday home to enjoy with all their family. They're looking for a house with great views and lots of outdoor space for Tony to exercise his green fingers on the Canary island of Tenerife. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their budget of £350,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Ali tries to keep her Spanish dream alive with a new business plan and Christine and Pete are having second thoughts just a year after opening their restaurant. In France, gite owners Lee and Zandra have their sights set on expansion

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Clairvoyant Yvette Tamara hosts the first dinner party in north Kent, and the night gets off to a spooky start when data analyst John Tower and working mother Yemi Christopher-Soares discover a ghost-busting machine. Meanwhile, jeweller Lisa Townend is so impressed with Yvette's abilities that she wants to return for a psychic reading

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Data analyst John Tower hosts the second dinner party in north Kent, and lets his passion for military re-enactment show when he barks orders at the table. However, not all the guests enjoy his fatty pork stew and psychedelic dessert, and two argue over dating etiquette

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Project manager Yemi Christopher-Soares hosts the third dinner party in north Kent, where she hopes the guests will enjoy her Nigerian-inspired menu and appreciate her love of all things spicy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jono Simm hosts the penultimate dinner party in north Kent and is convinced his wholesome and hearty menu is the way to win. However, two of his guests are less than impressed by his cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Lisa Townend hosts the final dinner party in north Kent, and hopes that a menu full of French fancies and innovative entertainment in the form of human roulette, will be enough to impress her guests and see her crowned winner of the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Michelle and Charlotte from Stevenage are looking for Michelle's dream holiday home on Lanzarote. As a family of four, they have been coming to the island for more than 10 years and feel particularly at home in the seaside town of Playa Blanca. Ben Hillman lines up five properties for their £110,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: John and Alison Peart from Devon are at a crossroads. With Alison hoping to retire in the next year and John being made redundant, they're focusing all their attention on finding a new home. While Alison wants to split her time to spend half the year in Dorset, close to their family, and the other six months in Tenerife, her favourite place, John would happily relocate permanently to Tenerife. Laura Hamilton shows them three fantastic homes in Dorset for their maximum £400,000 UK budget while Jonnie Irwin tempts them with three amazing properties in Tenerife for up to £235,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Celebrity photographer John wants to celebrate his 60th birthday by relocating to the idyllic Greek Island of Skopelos. Having fallen in love with its beautiful scenery and relaxing way of life, all he needs is to find his dream property - so friend Helen is coming along for support. Ben Hillman selects five options to put in the frame for his £120,000 budget, hoping at least one will be John's idea of perfection

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: The final stop on the search for Britain's best amateur pianists is Birmingham New Street Station. Featuring a toe-tapping Jerry Lee Lewis hit and a unique Harry Styles cover. There is not a dry eye in the station when a Welsh retiree goes on a trip down memory lane. As per usual, the unsuspecting performers are being watched by Lang Lang and Mika who are looking for a pianist to play at the Royal Festival Hall

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc: Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. In the first episode, he shares a roast chicken recipe that saves both time and money by filling chicken thighs with a super-simple stuffing to make the meat stretch further. Plus, a pancake batter-based dish with layers of spinach, ham and cheese and a pizza that doesn't even need you to turn on the oven

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mark and Caroline want a bolthole on Spain's stunning Orihuela Costa that works for all the family and is close to the golf courses. Scarlette Douglas shows them what their £100,000 budget can secure

Eviction specialists also come to the aid of Amit, who found himself continuing his late father's battle with a nightmare renter, and 70-year-old landlady Joan, who started receiving unnerving threats from her rent-skipping tenant after she started legal proceedings to get him evicted

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A member of the public reports a car veering erratically across the M1 and Karl Jackson and Matt Cooling are sent to investigate. They catch the vehicle up and box it in at traffic lights on a slip road, where the driver, smelling of alcohol, is dragged out and refuses a breathalyser test. Jason Potts is called to a rush-hour crash on the A50, while Alex Boniface takes the lead in the pursuit of a stolen Audi

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Ant Horsley is one of a team of officers pursuing a car suspected of being linked to the drugs trade, and a high-speed and hazardous chase ensues across the Peak District. Ant is also involved when another car is pulled over near a busy junction and its driver is arrested, with police finding what they suspect to be rocks of crack cocaine and heroin parcelled up in the car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Two officers make a surprising discovery while apprehending a gang of car thieves, and a team uses automatic number-plate recognition to identify stolen vehicles outside the biggest shopping centre in Essex. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers conduct a 48-hour hunt for a thief who stole a 4x4, and their perseverance pays off when they manage to catch the culprit. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team is forced to don full riot gear on New Year's Eve to deal with a knife-wielding man, and unprecedented snowfall brings chaos to the roads of Essex. programme.desc: Around 11,000 automatic number plate recognition cameras continually monitor vehicles on Britain's roads. programme.desc: Officers track down the people responsible for stealing an expensive TV, and carry out an impairment test on a driver suspected of being under the influence of drugs. The first episode in the final season of the crime drama, starring Jeremy Sisto, Anthony Anderson and Sam Waterston

programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate after an aspiring musician is found dead behind a bin, and a bag of money left nearby leads them to a number of suspects. One of them confesses to the shooting, but says he only did it because he thought his daughter had been abducted. Further investigation by the detectives reveals that there may be a link between their case and a possible terrorist threat. Guest starring Michael Kenneth Williams (The Wire, Boardwalk Empire)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the death of an heiress from an apparent drug overdose. However, the duo soon realise there is more to the case than meets the eye, as they uncover a conspiracy to kill off wealthy cancer patients so inheritors do not have to pay an estate tax

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: NCIS
